text: I am struggling with using dates as ticks on the axis. In Plots.jl you can just plot dates as x-data and the axis is formatted consequently. How do I achieve the same in Makie?

elements.text: I am struggling with using dates as ticks on the axis. In Plots.jl you can just plot dates as x-data and the axis is formatted consequently. How do I achieve the same in Makie?

text: it's a bit different in Makie as the underlying tick values always have to be numerical (at least currently), so I think you need to convert the Dates to numbers, then plot those, and set the tick formatter to something that can then convert back to dates and choose good tick values there, and format them accordingly (in MakieLayout that is)

text: in Plots these things are often a bit simpler to do because they don't do interaction like we do (I think) so they only have to do the dates -> numbers / tick labels conversion once and not all the time, dynamically

text: You habe to plot `Dates.value.(dates_vec)`. The format is a bit more complex because returning a Date does not automatically convert it to a String. I used `xtickformat = x -> *map*(y -> Dates.*format*(*Date*(d -> Dates.*value*(d) >= y, 2020),"yyyy-mm-dd"),x)`, where I started the date iteration in 2020.
